info.description: Restricted assets serve as a safeguard and are used prevent assets from being traded in Aladdin. The Restricted Assets API can be used to list, create, update, upsert, filter and terminated restricted assets.
info.title: Restricted Assets

get.description:
This endpoint allows for retrieval of current or future restricted assets by portfolio Id.
The maximum number of restricted assets that can be returned in one call is 10000.
Please use pagination to limit the number of records returned. A pageSize of less than 1 will return all records.
Permissions Required: View permission for the given portfolioCode/ticker

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
The maximum number of Restricted Asset to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 10000
Restricted Assets will be returned. The maximum value is 10000; values
above 10000 will be rejected and exception will be thrown.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous `ListRestrictedAssets` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to `ListRestrictedAssets` must match
the call that provided the page token.
parameters.name: pageToken

post.description:
This endpoint allows for creation of new restricted assets for a given portfolio.
The maximum number of restricted assets that can be created in one call is 1000.
Permissions Required: asReAsMOD

post.description:
This endpoint allows for the termination of restricted assets for a given portfolio.
The maximum number of restricted assets that can be terminated in one call is 1000.
Permissions Required: asReAsMOD

post.description:
This endpoint can be used to upsert restricted assets for a given portfolio.
Set the end date to closed, and add the new restricted assets by setting new values.
The maximum number of restricted assets that can be upserted in one call is 1000.
Permissions Required: asReAsMOD

post.description:
This endpoint allows filtering for restricted assets based on a number of parameters.
For a call to be successful, you must specify either a portfolioCode or ticker to filter by.
The maximum number of restricted assets that can be returned in one call is 10000. Please use pagination to limit the number of records returned.
A pageSize of less than 1 will return all records.
Permissions Required: View permission for the given portfolioCode/ticker

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

enumsRestrictedAssetState.description:
- RESTRICTED_ASSET_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified Restricted Asset State
 - RESTRICTED_ASSET_STATE_YES: Represents Yes
 - RESTRICTED_ASSET_STATE_NO: Represents No
enumsRestrictedAssetState.title: Describes the Restricted Asset State enum

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

v1BatchCreateRestrictedAssetsRequest.title: Defines the input for creation of the restricted assets

requests.title: Represents the list of Restricted Assets to be added

v1BatchCreateRestrictedAssetsResponse.title: Defines the response of creation of the restricted assets

results.description: Results indicating success or error of the Create operation for each Restricted Asset in the batch.

requests.title: Represents the list of Restricted Assets to be terminated

results.description: Results indicating success or error of the Terminate operation for each RestrictedAsset in the batch.

v1CreateRestrictedAssetRequest.title:
Defines create Restriction Asset request
(-- api-linter: core::0133::request-parent-required=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we allow to create restricted assets for multiple portfolio ids --)

v1CreateRestrictedAssetResult.description: The Result body of the BatchCreateRestrictedAssets call.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

v1FilterRestrictedAssetsRequest.title: Defines the input for Restricted Assets filter request

query.title:
Filter over the collection and only return results that the user is
interested in.
At least one field must be set in the query message

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterRestrictedAssets' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterRestrictedAssets' must match the call that provided the page
token.

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of Restricted Asset to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 10000
Restricted Assets will be returned. The maximum value is 10000; values
above 10000 will be rejected and exception will be thrown.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages, or the pagination option was unused.

restrictedAssets.title: Represents the list of Restricted Asset

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages, or the pagination option was unused.

id.title: Represents the Restricted Asset composite Id

endDate.description: Represents the date the security comes off restriction.

restrictedAmount.description: Represents the restricted amount of security to be restricted.

author.title:
Represents who entered the value
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it can be null --)
It's ignored in case of Create, Update, Upsert requests

entryDate.title:
Represents the entry date, when this source entered
It's ignored in case of Create, Update, Upsert requests

purpose.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is the name of the field. --)
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it is not a reference. --)
Represents the purpose, indicates why this security is restricted.
The incoming value will be validated to be an existing, valid purpose in the Aladdin decodes table using the RestrAssetReas table description.
The validation is case sensitive

state.description: Represents the state. Available for sale or not. The value can not be UNSPECIFIED in case of UPDATE/CREATE/UPSERT operations
state.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is the name of the field --)
Represents the state. Available for sale or not.
The value can not be UNSPECIFIED in case of UPDATE/CREATE/UPSERT operations

restrictionCode.title:
Represents the restriction code. User defined code that can be attached to restriction.
This field can be set from the Mortgage Browser so that a portfolio manager can define a reason for restricting certain assets

source.title:
Represents the source. Link to id of an external source where restriction originated
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is a generic field --)

startDate.description: Represents the date the security starts being restricted.

v1RestrictedAssetQuery.title: Defines the restricted asset query criteria

portfolioCode.title:
Represents portfolio code
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we allow filtering by others fields without portfolio id --)

startDate.description: Represents the date the security starts being restricted.

endDate.description: Represents the date the security comes off restriction.

restrictedAmount.description: Represents the restricted amount of security to be restricted.

author.title:
Represents the entry date, when this source entered
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it can be null --)

purpose.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is the name of the field. --)
Represents the purpose, indicates why this security is restricted.
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it is not a reference)

state.title:
Represents the state. Available for sale or not.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is the name of the field --)

restrictionCode.title:
Represents the restriction code. User defined code that can be attached to restriction.
This field can be set from the Mortgage Browser so that a portfolio manager can define a reason for restricting certain assets

source.title:
Represents the source. Link to id of an external source where restriction originated
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is a generic field --)

id.title:
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the Restricted Asset resource has a composite id --)
The id of the Restricted Assets to terminate

terminationDate.title:
Defines the termination date. It can not point to the past.
If it is not provided, the incoming Restricted Asset resource will be terminated with the current date

v1TerminateRestrictedAssetResult.title: The Result body of the BatchTerminateRestrictedAssets call

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

updateMask.title:
List of fields to be updated.
Currently not supported

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

updateMask.title:

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
scopes.portfolio.configuration.restricted_asset: This grants access to all endpoints in the portfolio.configuration.restricted_asset.v1.RestrictedAsset API

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
scopes.portfolio.configuration.restricted_asset: This grants access to all endpoints in the portfolio.configuration.restricted_asset.v1.RestrictedAsset API
